name: Five Stairsteps
description: The '''Five Stairsteps''', known as "The First Family of Soul" and later "The Invisible Man's Band", were an [[Americans|American]] [[Chicago soul]] [[musical ensemble|group]] made up of five of Betty and Clarence Burke Sr.'s six children: Alohe Jean, Clarence Jr., James, Dennis, and [[Keni Burke|Kenneth "Keni"]], and briefly, Cubie. They are best known for the 1970 song "[[O-o-h Child]]", listed at number 402 on [[List of Rolling Stone's 500 Greatest Songs of All Time|''Rolling Stone'''s 500 Greatest Songs of All Time]].
